title: New Orleans/Charity Head Trauma/Injury Rule
description: Offers criteria for which patients are unlikely to require imaging after head trauma. Use ONLY in patients with head injury and loss of consciousness who are neurologically normal (GCS 15).

ranges.interpretation: CT scan not required. The patient meets none of the New Orleans criteria. The rule is 100% sensitive for detecting intracranial injuries requiring neurosurgical intervention.
CT scan recommended. The patient meets at least one of the New Orleans criteria. Consider CT head imaging to rule out intracranial injury.

references: Haydel MJ, Preston CA, Mills TJ, Luber S, Blaudeau E, DeBlieux PM. Indications for computed tomography in patients with minor head injury. N Engl J Med. 2000 Jul 13;343(2):100-5. doi: 10.1056/NEJM200007133430204.
formula: If ANY criteria are positive (present), CT scan is recommended
notes: Use ONLY in patients with head injury and loss of consciousness who are neurologically normal (GCS 15)
100% sensitive for detecting intracranial injuries requiring neurosurgical intervention
Less specific than other head injury rules like the Canadian CT Head Rule
Goal is to identify patients who need head CT imaging after minor head trauma
Excludes patients with focal neurologic findings, refusal of CT, or no loss of consciousness
